pr_title: Graphiti methods pull up to VirSat Core - (Task #477)

timeline.message:
Graphiti methods pull up to VirSat Core - (Task #477)

Pulls up SWTBot Graphiti test methods to Virsat Core's SWTBotTestCase
class.

---
Task #477: Pull up SWTBot Graphiti Diagram Editor methods

timeline.bodyText: We need some comments here on this method and how it works since it does some crazy reflection stuff.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
I am not a 100% sure if we can generalize this so easily.
The "Open Diagram Editor" handler in FDIR is a custom handler.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: I'll remove it for now until we come up with a better more generic way
replies.author: christoph-pietsch-DLR

timeline.message:
Resolved comments - (Task #477)

timeline.bodyText: Usually the comments for methods go above the parameter descriptions.

Task #477: Pull up SWTBot Graphiti Diagram Editor methods

timeline.bodyText: At the moment we do not bind versions in Virtual Satellite when possible. please remove the specific version
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Maybe refactor string to static member variable in TestCase or UtilityClass.
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: show error also in log. Log can be accessed via the bundle activators. such as Activator.getLog.log(…)
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: If you log it with the Activator you no longer need to print the stacktrace.

replies.bodyText: Philipp's comment was "show error also in log". So I assumed desired behavior was doing both.

timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: It seems my IDE mixes up tabs and spaces formating regularly, which is hard to spot if displaying whitespaces isnt turned on. Can we add this check to checkstyle globally?
replies.author: christoph-pietsch-DLR

replies.bodyText: I think it is possible. We can look into it.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to do this? I think a comment would be nice
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR
